com.opatomic

Interface OpaClient<T,E>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Object type for sending/receiving objects
    E - Error type for error responses
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    OpaStreamClient

    public interface OpaClient<T,E>
    Opatomic client interface used to send commands and receive the responses via callbacks. Unless otherwise specified in implementation, the args parameters must not be modified until response callback is invoked. ie, when call()/callA()/callAP() returns, the request may not have been serialized completely, meaning the args parameter might be in-use by serialization code.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void call(java.lang.String cmd, java.util.Iterator<T> args, CallbackSF<T,E> cb)
      Run specified command on server.
      void callA(java.lang.String cmd, java.util.Iterator<T> args, CallbackSF<T,E> cb)
      Run specified command on server with an auto-generated asynchronous id.
      java.lang.Object callAP(java.lang.String cmd, java.util.Iterator<T> args, CallbackSF<T,E> sub)
      Run specified command on server with an auto-generated asynchronous id.
      boolean unregister(java.lang.Object id)
      Remove the callback for a callAP() invocation.

    • Method Detail

      • call

        void call(java.lang.String cmd,
          java.util.Iterator<T> args,
          CallbackSF<T,E> cb)
        Run specified command on server.
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to run
        args - Command's parameters. Do not modify
        cb - Callback to invoke when response is received. If null then server will not send a response

      • callA

        void callA(java.lang.String cmd,
           java.util.Iterator<T> args,
           CallbackSF<T,E> cb)
        Run specified command on server with an auto-generated asynchronous id. Specified callback is invoked once, when response received. Response can arrive out of order. Command must respond only 1 time... do not use this for SUBSCRIBE (use callAP() instead).
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to run
        args - Command's parameters. Do not modify
        cb - Callback to invoke when response is received. Cannot be null.

      • callAP

        java.lang.Object callAP(java.lang.String cmd,
                        java.util.Iterator<T> args,
                        CallbackSF<T,E> sub)
        Run specified command on server with an auto-generated asynchronous id. Specified callback is invoked every time a response is received. Command can respond any number of times. Use this for SUBSCRIBE.
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to run
        args - Command's parameters. Do not modify
        sub - Callback to invoke when responses are received. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        An id that can be used to unregister() when done listening for responses to the command

      • unregister

        boolean unregister(java.lang.Object id)
        Remove the callback for a callAP() invocation. Must call this when response from UNSUBSCRIBE is received. Otherwise you will have a memory leak.
        Parameters:
        id - The id returned from callAP()
        Returns:
        true if async callback id was found and removed; false if id was not found
